etymology.description: 好(好) (hǎo, "good") + 吧(吧) (ba, "particle indicating suggestion") = "alright; fine" as a suggestion or mild agreement.
etymology.interpretation: 好(好) (hǎo, "good") suggests positivity or agreement, while 吧(吧) (ba, "particle indicating suggestion") softens the tone, making a suggestion or implying a reluctant assent. This combination expresses a casual agreement or willingness to go along with something.

parts.english: particle indicating suggestion; mild command; assumption

examples.chinese: 我们试试这个办法(我們試試這個辦法)，好吧(好吧)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen shìshi zhège bànfǎ, hǎo ba.

examples.chinese: 今天下雨了(今天下雨了)，好吧(好吧)。
